data.title: Musicians Born on October 13
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays in music for the 13th of October. See which composers, musicians, pop stars and rockers were born on October 13.
data.text:
Johann Heinrich Kittel, German composer, born in Dresden, Electorate of Saxony, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1682)

Frantiszek Sołtyk, Polish composer, born in Piastów, Poland (d. 1865)

Moritz Hauptmann, German composer, born in Dresden, Electorate of Saxony, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1868)

Anselm Hüttenbrenner, Austrian composer, born in Graz, Austria (d. 1868)

Carl Martin Reinthaler, German composer, born in Erfurt, Germany (d. 1896)

Immanuel Faisst, German composer, born in Esslingen am Neckar, Stuttgart, Germany (d. 1894)

Henry Stephen Cutler, American church organist and hymn composer, born in Boston, Massachusetts (d. 1902)

Peter Van Anrooy, Dutch conductor and composer (Piet Hein Rhapsodie), born in Zaltbommel, the Netherlands (d. 1954)

George Bacovia [Vasiliu], Romanian poet and composer (Plumb), born in Bacău, Romania (d. 1957)

Gösta Nystroem, Swedish composer, born in Silvbergs, Sweden (d. 1966)

Marcelle de Manziarly, French pianist and composer, born in Kharkiv, Russian Empire (d. 1989)

Gerald Marks, American songwriter ("All of Me"), born in Saginaw, Michigan (d. 1997)

1900 Marius-François Gaillard, French pianist (DeBussy), conductor and composer (La passion noire), born in Paris (d. 1973)

Jens Bjerre, Danish composer, born in Aarhus (d. 1986)

Scoville "Toby" Browne, American jazz saxophone and clarinet player, born in Atlanta, Georgia (d. 1994)

Art Tatum [Arthur Tatum Jr], American jazz pianist and composer, born in Toledo, Ohio (d. 1956)

1910 Otto Joachim, German-Canadian composer, born in Düsseldorf, Germany (d. 2010)

André Navarra, French concert cellist (Jolivet's Cello Concerto), and educator (Paris Conservatoire, 1947-88), born in Biarritz, France (d. 1988)

1911 Ticker Freeman, American pianist (Dinah Shore Show), and songwriter ("Baby Don't Be Mad at Me"), born in Paterson, New Jersey (d. 1986)

Hugo Weisgall, American composer (4 Impressions), born in Ivančice, Czech Republic (d. 1997)

Jack Fallon, Canadian-British jazz double and electric bass player, fiddler (The Beatles -"Don't Pass Me By"), and concert promoter, born in London, Ontario, Canada (d. 2006)

David Hollestelle, Dutch baritone singer (Dutch Radio Chorus), born in Den Helder, Netherlands (d. 2001)

Albert Hague [Marcuse], German-American actor, singer and composer (Fame; How the Grinch Stole Christmas), born in Berlin, Germany (d. 2001)

Harper MacKay, American orchestra leader (NBC Follies), born in Boston, Massachusetts (d. 1995)

Alan Scott, American lyricist (Candid Camera theme), writer, TV host (Spin the Picture), and actor, born in Haddonfield, New Jersey (d. 2021)

1922 Gilberto Mendes, Brazilian classical and avant-garde composer, born in Santos, Brazil (d. 2016)

Terry Gibbs [Julius Gubenko], American jazz vibraphonist and bandleader (The Dream Band; Steve Allen Comedy Hour), born in Brooklyn, New York

Gustav Winckler, Danish pop singer ("Skibet skal sejle i nat"- "The Ship Is Leaving Tonight"), born in Nørrebro, Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1979)

Ray Brown, American jazz double bassist (Oscar Peterson; Ella Fitzgerald), born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (d. 2002)

1926 Tommy Whittle, British jazz tenor saxophonist (Ted Heath; BBC Show Band), and bandleader, born in Grangemouth, Scotland (d. 2013)

(Leon) "Lee" Konitz, American jazz saxophonist (Miles Davis - Birth of the Cool), born in Chicago, Illinois (d. 2020)

1927 Anita Kerr [née Grilli], American pop and country singer, composer, and producer (The Anita Kerr Singers), born in Memphis, Tennessee (d. 2022) [1] [2]

Johnny Lytle, American jazz drummer and vibraphonist, known as "Fast Hands", born in Springfield, Ohio (d. 1995)

1932 Liliane Montevecchi, French-Italian actress, dancer, and singer (Nine; Grand Hotel), born in Paris, France (d. 2018)

Adam Kaczyński, Polish pianist and composer, born in Warsaw, Poland (d. 2010)

Nana Mouskouri, Greek singer (Try to Remember), born in Chania, Crete, Greece

Alexey Kozlov, Russian jazz-fusion saxophonist, bandleader, and composer (Arsenal), born in Moscow, USSR

Enzo Dara, Italian operatic basso buffo (The Barber of Seville - "Don Bartolo"), and author, born in Mantua, Kingdom of Italy (d. 2017)

(Farrell) "Pharoah" Sanders, American jazz saxophonist (John Coltrane groups; "Karma"), born in Little Rock, Arkansas (d. 2022) [1]

1940 Chris Farlowe [John Henry Deighton], British rock singer ("Out of Time"), born in London, England

Neil Aspinall, British rock and roll road manager (The Beatles), and music executive (Apple Records), born in Prestatyn, Wales (d. 2008)

Paul Simon

American multiple Grammy Award-winning singer-songwriter (Simon & Garfunkel - "The Sound of Silence"; solo - "Kodachrome"; "Still Crazy After All These Years"; "Graceland"), and actor (One Trick Pony), born in Newark, New Jersey

Robert Lamm, American keyboardist, songwriter, and vocalist (Chicago - "Does Anybody Really Know What Time It Is?": "Beginnings"; "Saturday in the Park"), born in Brooklyn, New York

Christophe [Daniel Bevilacqua], French singer (Aline), born in Juvisy-sur-Orge, Paris

1945 Karen Akers, American singer (On Stage at Wolf Trap), born in New York City

Bram Vermeulen, Dutch singer (Neerlands Hoop), born in The Hague, Netherlands

1946 Dorothy Moore, American blues, gospel, and R&B singer ("Misty Blue"), born in Jackson, Mississippi

1946 Lacy J. Dalton, American country singer ("Crazy Blue Eyes"), born in Bloomsburg, Pennsylvania [1]

Sammy Hagar, American rock vocalist ("I Can't Drive 55"; Van Halen, 1985-96 - "Right Now"), born in Salinas, California

John Ford Coley, American musician (England Dan & John Ford Coley - "I'd Really Love To See You Tonight"), born in Dallas, Texas

1948 Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, Pakistani qawwal (Sufi devotional music) vocalist, and composer, born in Lyallpur, Pakistan (d. 1997)

1948 Pete Spencer, British drummer and songwriter (Smokie, 1973-86 - "This Time We'll Get It Right"; "San Francisco Bay"), born in Leeds, England

Rick Vito, American session and touring rock guitarist and singer (Fleetwood Mac, 1987-91, born in Darby, Pennsylvania

1949 Robert Sirota, American classical composer, born in New York, New York

Simon Nicol, British folk-rock guitarist, singer, and record producer (Fairport Convention), born in Muswell Hill, London, England

Pierre Lacocque, Belgian-American blues harmonica player (Mississippi Heat), born in Jerusalem, Israel

Charles Giordano, American session and touring keyboardist, organist, and accordionist (Pat Benatar, 1982-91; E Street Band, 2006-present), born in Brooklyn, New York

Frans van Oostrom, Dutch jazz and blues guitarist, born in Amsterdam, Netherlands

Jair-Rôhm Parker Wells, American musician and composer (Machine Gun), born in Tacoma, Washington

1958 Ricky Sylvers, American R&B guitarist and vocalist (The Sylvers - "Boogie Fever"), born in Memphis, Tennessee

Gerry Darby, British jazz-soul drummer (Carmel - "Bad Day"), born in England

1959 Marie Osmond, American pop singer ("Paper Roses"), and actress (Goin' Coconuts), born in Ogden, Utah

Joey Belladonna [Bellardini], American heavy metal vocalist (Anthrax, 1984-92 - "I Am The Law"), born in Oswego, New York

Michael Lavine, American portrait photographer and contributor to several grunge rock album art packages (Nirvana; Soundgarden), born in San Francisco, California

Charlie Jones, British session bass player, songwriter, and record producer (Robert Plant), born in Bristol, England [some sources cite 1963]

Eugene Alcalay, Romanian concert pianist, composer, and educator, born in Bucharest, Romania (d. 2019)

Carlos Marín, Spanish pop-opera baritone (Il Divo), born in Mörfelden-Walldorf, West Germany (d. 2021)

Mel Jackson, African-American actor (Soul Food) and R&B musician, born in Chicago, Illinois

1970 Paul Potts, British pop-opera singer and 1st winner of Britain's Got Talent (2007), born in Kingswood, South Gloucestershire, England

Roger Lima [Manganelli], Brazilian ska singer and bassist (Less Than Jake), born in Porto Alegre

Hawick Lau, Hong Kong Chinese actor (Sealed with a Kiss) and singer, born in Hong Kong

Ashanti [Douglas] American singer ("Always On Time"), born in Glen Cove, Long Island, New York

1980 Jon Micah Sumrall, American singer (Kutless), born in Ashland, Oregon

Kele Okereke, Nigerian-English musician (Bloc Party), born in Liverpool, England

Misono [Kōda], Japanese pop singer (Day After Tomorrow; "It's All Love!"), and TV personality (Quiz! Hexagon II), born in Kyoto, Japan

Jimin

South Korean singer-songwriter (BTS), born in Busan, South Korea
